Overview: This breadth track progressively develops knowledge and skills in French language for students who are at a super advanced Level.
Subject Options: Students can extend this subject by taking other French elective subjects.
Notes: Students will be required to sit a placement test to determine language proficiency level. Subjects may be substituted with appropriate alternatives depending on proficiency level attained. Students should contact track coordinator to discuss subject alternatives.
What is a Breadth Track?: A breadth track is a sequence of three or more subjects (taken as part of a Melbourne Bachelor degree) that progressively develops knowledge and skills relevant to a coherent domain, theme, topic or issue. It is a suggested set of subjects, rather than a requirement.
